String theory has too many solutions, the critics say. But even Newton‚Äôs theory has an infinite number of solutions. We pick one initial condition, and solve equations for the future. So... you must select the initial conditions at the Big Bang, and let string theory do the rest.

If Einstein had never been born ...
string theory would have found general relativity anyway. The lowest vibrations of the string contain spin-two massless particles (the graviton) which in turn can be used to generate the entire theory of general relativity.

What can the God Equation do? It can determine
1. what lies on the other side of a black hole
2. where the big bang came from
3. if other universes exist
4. if time travel is possible
5. if higher dimensions are possible
6. how to escape the Big Freeze and the death the universe

5 ways string theory might be tested:
1. look for deviations from the Standard Model
2. determine the nature of Dark Matter
3. use LISA to detect gravity waves from the Big Bang 
4. Japan, China, and Europe may build new accelerators
5. look for deviations in inverse square law

What‚Äôs the mew LHC result? In the Standard Model, the muon (found in cosmic rays) and the electron are identical, except the muon is heavier. But new results (on the magnetic properties of the muon) show a large
discrepancy between the electron and muon, signaling new physics!!

The Standard Model of particles, no matter how ugly it is, has survived for 50 years because it fits the data. This has stifled research in new theories, like strings. But now, there is potential crack in the Standard Model, opening the way for a higher theory.

One of the main criticisms of string theory is that it cannot be tested, since each solution in a universe, so a direct test requires creating a baby universe. But his new LHC result just might be the simplest way to show the presence of a higher theory, maybe even strings.

Physicists are looking very closely at the latest results from the LHC, where the muon and electron (which should be identical) seem to have different properties. This may signal the presence of a higher theory, involving new particles, perhaps even string theory. Time will tell.
